thread.section_title: Commodities Market News - Yahoo!7 Australia Finance
thread.title: Aust bonds weaken as equities gain
thread.title_full: Aust bonds weaken as equities gain

title: Aust bonds weaken as equities gain
text:
Wed, Aug 26, 2015, 5:24 PM AEST - Australia Markets closed Aust bonds weaken as equities gain AAP â€“ 24 minutes ago Print 
The Australian bond market is weaker, after the local sharemarket enjoyed another day of gains, helped by the Chinese central bank cutting its key interest rate. 
The People's Bank of China cut its benchmark interest rates and the amount of cash banks must keep on hand in a move to boost its economy as it battles sharemarket turmoil. 
Chinese equities responded on Wednesday, eking out gains of around two per cent, following eight and seven per per cent falls on Monday and Tuesday. 
Nomura rates strategist Andrew Ticehurst said the move into equites caused some weakness in the safe haven asset of bonds. 
"The stocks market is certainly taking a little bit of comfort from the policy easing from China," he said. 
"I'd say market sentiment is still fragile and I'd say that market volatility is going to continue for some time as we continue to watch the Chinese stock market gyrate." 
Mr Ticehurst said falls in bond prices were limited because there is an increased chance of another rate cut by the Reserve Bank next year, and some observers are even tipping one late this year. 
He said that bond markets will now be focusing on a speech by New York Federal Reserve Bank president William Dudley, for clues as to whether the recent market turmoil has changed the Fed's interest rate outlook. 
At 1630 AEST on Wednesday, the September 2015 10-year bond futures contract was trading at 97.315 (implying a yield of 2.685 per cent), down from 97.370 (2.630 per cent) on Tuesday. 
The September 2015 three-year bond futures contract was at 98.230 (1.770 per cent), down from 98.250 (1.750 per cent). 
KEY MOVEMENTS: 
* CGS 5.5pct Jan 2018, 1.755pct, from 1.739pct on Tuesday 
* CGS 4.25pct April 2026, 2.733pct, from 2.670pct 
Sydney Futures Exchange prices: 
* September 2015 bill futures, 97.940 from 97.930 
* December 2015 bill futures, 98.090, from 98.080 
(*Closes taken at 1630 AEST previous local session) 
Source: IRESS
